content.question: A parallel plate capacitor with capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> is connected to a battery of potential difference <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> volt and charged. The capacitor is then discharged, a dielectric of constant <math alttext="kappa equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>Îº</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mstyle></math> is inserted into the capacitor, and the capacitor is then connected to a second battery with potential difference <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> volts. What is the ratio of the capacitance in this second arrangement to the original capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
